I bought this game years ago, when it was released, and it is still fun to replay every once in a while, because it's bloody brilliant! The Co-Op Mode is the most challenging and entertaining, too. You just can't help but getting addicted to this game. :)

I originally bought this when it first came out in 2011 for the Xbox 360 and had a fantastic time playing. Three years later I decided during a sale to pick it up once again, but for PC since I no longer owned the console or game. Even after three years it holds up as a fabulous head scratching puzzle game.

The story is just as amazing and witty as the first installment and even with Portal 2 being much longer than Portal I am still left wanting more. Thankfully there is co-op and even player created levels to keep my mind sharp and to enjoy with friends.

10/10
This is a very fun and challenging game the 4 yrs of making was worth!
muy buen juego, al principio un poco aburrido pero despues es muy entretenido y tiene un final exelente ;)

Portal 2 is an AMAZING follow-up to its predecessor. For the overly smart players, the campaign could be around 6 hours long, but if you take your time or have trouble with the puzzles, expect it to be somewhere closer to 12 hours. I found this was long enough for me to enjoy the cast of characters, and the brilliantly written story. The game takes place in different areas of the Aperture Science facility. There's new Aperture, 40s-50s Aperture, 70s Aperture and so on. With each setting, comes a new way to complete the puzzles. For example, gel and Franken Cubes. But I'm rambling on... GET THE GAME NOW!

Szerintem méltán lehetne az évtized játéka :) Nekem évek óta személyes kedvenc, nem bírta a trónról semmi letaszítani. Vicces, kedves játék. Ezenfelül viszont eléggé megdolgoztatja az agyat néha, amikor egy monumentális épületrendszer előtt állva kéne A-ból B-be jutni, te meg egyhelyben nézelődsz, hogy most hova :)

Az együttműködő játék is nagyon el van találva. :) Csak ajánlani tudom!
AWESOME game :O The game is not so long in Single-player but it is very exciting in Co-OP with friends.

This game is easily one of the most entertaining games ever made.
The concept is widely known, and looking at the gameplay trailers, I doubt I need to explain it.

This game has humor, challenge, co-op, and freaking AMAZING plot twists.

My favorite moment has to be either "the lemon speech" which is encountered in [spoiler]Old Aperture.[/spoiler]

The lemon speech: 
[b]"All right, I've been thinking. When life gives you lemons, don't make lemonade. Make life take the lemons back! Get mad! I don't want your damn lemons! What am I supposed to do with these?! Demand to see life's manager! Make life rue the day it thought it could give Cave Johnson lemons! Do you know who I am?! I'm the man who's gonna burn your house down! With the lemons! I'm gonna get my engineers to invent a combustible lemon that burns your house down!"[/b]

My second favorite has to be: 

[spoiler]GLaDOS[/spoiler]: "Oh no! This is the part where he kills you."
[spoiler]Wheatly[/spoiler]: "Hello! This is the part where I kill you."
You got an acheivment: The part where he kills you. (description: "This is that part.")
Song that begins playing is named: The part where he kills you.

[i]„Jeden portál sem, druhý tady, popadnout kostu, projít portálem, položit kostku a projít dveřmi.“[/i]

+ Logická hra - obtížnost tak akorát, ani tak jednoduché, ale v některých testovacích místnostech se zapotíte
+ Hra vás netestuje ze stále stejných věcí - v každé místnosti se potkáte s novým logickým konceptem
+ Celkový koncept hry - už jenom ten nápad!
+ Příběh? Řeknete si, „Je to logická hra, to zas bude suchej příběh.“ Je tomu přesně naopak! Výborný, zábávný a nenudící příběh je bez diskuze nejlepší část této hry?
+ Pokud dohraje hlavní herní kampaň (délka nad 10 hodin), můžete se přesunout do skvěle zpracovaného co-op
+ Dohráli jste i co-op se svým přítelem? Velká řada dalších testovacích místnosti z Workshopu vás dokáže zaměstnat na další desítky hodin 

- Mínusy? Má tahle hra vůbec nějaké? 

Jedna z nejlepších her vůbec - pokud ne, určitě se zařadí na první příčky v žebříčku logických her. Valve hry dělat umělo, umí a doufejme, dělat bude umět.

"It's like Portal, but with more!" 10/10

If you liked the original 'Portal' game then there is no reason whatsoever for why you shouldn't absolutely love the sequel. It's got new obstacles like super dangerous lasers, improved graphics, a more lively atmosphere, a hilarious British tour guide, the return of that condescending GLaDOS, and hours upon hours of mind-bending new puzzles. Hell, even if you don't like the puzzles you should get this game for GLaDOS and her bright eyed optimism alone. Because who doesn't like getting talked down to by a robot who is smarter and more accomplished than you are? I know that I sure do! Are there any puzzle games out there that are more original and entertaining than 'Portal 2'? If so, could somebody please point me in the right direction?
Excellent Game, Worth Every penny.

Druga część gry Valva o tytule "Portal". Do tej gry wprowadzono więcej elementów interaktywnych, ciekawsze (moim zdaniem) plansze i tryb kooperacyjny (spisujący się świetnie). Zostawiono z poprzedniej gry możliwość grania w dodatkowe poziomy. Niestety fabuła nie jest taka dobra, a i klimat gry się znacznie zmienił. Na dodatek plansze są znacznie prostsze. W sumie to zależy od gustu. Na szczęście pomimo tego w grę pogrywa się świetnie i z pewnością jest to bardzo dobry tytuł. Koniec końców, warto się "Portalem 2" zainteresować.
Single-player campaing was suprisingly good, given all the reviews saying it's crap compared to the original. The new mechanics fit in nicely.
Best puzzle game ever, obviously.

Portal 2 — игра на один раз. Зато какой! Отточив перья и логику на первой части, Valve выпустила образцовый сиквел, к которому почти не придраться. Локации масштабнее и разнообразнее, графика — техничнее, повествование — глубже. Основа основ — по-прежнему пушка, создающая два взаимосвязанных портала, правда, механика стала гораздо сложнее.
Fajna gra, a zwlaszcza w kooperacji

I don't even know where to begin.  There's just something about this game that made me fall in love.  GLaDOS, Wheatley, Cave Johnson. Even the little turrets are great, although it makes me sad to have to kill them because they're so adorable.  I'm obsessed with Portal.  I even got Cave Johnson's quote about life and lemons on my ipod case.  

But my favorite thing about Portal isn't just the characters, it's the atmosphere of Aperture Laboratories too. I like the feeling of being alone in this enormous abandoned science facility with only a few robots and a Companion Cube for company.  Portal is just one of those games you never want to end.

So yes, I would highly recommend Portal/Portal 2. It is my favorite game after all. :D

终于等到打折了迫不及待入手通了单人剧情，起初GLaDOS的实验室非常有意思可是随着剧情的深入难度增加了地图也大了导致我经常迷路（跪，以至于花了大量时间找路，不过一旦通过了就会感觉很爽（我真TM机智，这也是这游戏乐趣的所在。剧情的话给wheatley背叛以后感觉下体隐隐作痛你个逗比居然反咬我一口，后面的实验室也弱智到爆。最后GLaDOS把我从月球拉了回来让我送了一口气，终于也有点人性了啊，主角可以一枪射到月球上简直震惊了。最后伴着机枪塔的大合奏到了地面，感觉好萌啊，GLaDOS唱的歌让我看完了工作人员名单，也就portal的歌能让我看完staff，谢谢valve带来这么好的游戏，但是G胖你数学什么时候才能好来个3啊。
最后的最后，没人陪我打合作啊啊啊啊啊啊啊

"Oh, it's you... It's been a long time. How have you been?"

Se fosse pra escolher uma palavra que definisse esse jogo, seria: Genial! Mas é óbvio que essa obra-prima da Valve merece mais, então, aqui estou eu refazendo minha análise ridícula de 3 linhas sobre esse jogo brilhante... Porque ele merece, me fascinou de uma forma que poucos fizeram.

Nessa sequência, mais uma vez no comando de Chell, além de mais uma vez se deparar com as conhecidas test chambers, você vai poder ter o prazer de caminhar por entre as instalações da Aperture Science, de vasculhar o cerne de um passado há muito esquecido, de imaginar como aquele lugar em ruínas foi um dia e como se tornou o que é, criar suas próprias teorias... sensação de déjà vu, e eu ADORO isso! Posso até dizer que foi essa sensação que me fez gostar de games, levando em conta os primeiros pelos quais me apaixonei. Portal já era considerado um grande game, mas diante de Portal 2, percebemos que era como um protótipo. E a Valve fez um trabalho maravilhoso, não somente dando continuidade a primeira ideia já vitoriosa, mas fazendo algo muito mais f*cking awesome, jogando bem no meio da sua cara, o tempo inteiro, a grandiosidade do título e uma história bem elaborada, cenários vastos e polidos de encher os olhos, e coisas que mal esperávamos ao jogar o primeiro. Além de sugerir o entrelaçamento com o universo de Half-Life, o que faz tudo ficar muito mais interessante! As dublagens foram muuuito bem trabalhadas e as falas são super cômicas, até hoje dou risada das coisas que a GLaDOS fala, como "Well done. Here come the test results: "You are a horrible person." That's what it says: a horrible person. We weren't even testing for that." XD E sobre jogar com um amigo, digo também que o modo cooperativo é realmente muito bom, é à parte da campanha mas não deixa nada a desejar, vai exigir muito de você e do parceiro, mas no final sempre vale a pena! E quando o instinto assassino bate, nada melhor do que jogar esse modo! 8D MWahahaha!
É isso, Portal 2 é um "must have", atinge um outro patamar no estilo "puzzle"! Recomendado, finalmente. XD

I bought it a couple of days ago because I wasn't convinced that the game was actually worth 20€. And you know what, it isn't, at least to me. Yes, the single-player campaign is roughly 3 times longer than the original, but that's still only 6 hours of content. That's why I waited for a sale that gave me enough of a discount, and 5€ is much more justifiable for this game, but only because I have absolutely no interest whatsoever in the co-op part of this game. If I did, I'd say 10€ or 15€ would've been ok, but I won't touch that mode at all because I like to play with myself, so I'm left with another comparably short single-player campaign.

But on to the meat of the game. It seemed to me that the first part was really slow, possibly to accommodate new players who haven't played the original and even later on many of the puzzles were very obvious. I really only got stuck on one puzzle and that was because I missed a small surface that you could actually put a portal on and thus had to consult a walkthrough, but the rest were fairly easy. Still, the mechanics they've added definitely expand on the possibilities of the basic gameplay. I liked manipulating the gels, but again, the placement of tubes basically made the solution extremely obvious and the challenge wasn't so much figuring out what to do, but in what order, which basically involved trial and error. This is the problem with a puzzle game that has one and precisely one solution and which absolutely has to be in first-person. But I really liked the boss fight at the end, it's a really good demonstration of using all of the available elements and all the skills the player has acquired over the course of the game and designing the battle around that, similarly to what the original did. It should be an example to designers around the world, that a boss isn't just a regular enemy that has more health, but a final exam on what we've learned up to that point. 

The environment design is pretty damn well executed. I especially liked the shift to the older abandoned tracts of the facility with the 50's and 70's inspired looks. In fact, the whole visual design is really pretty to look at, although the draw-distance is pretty damn horrible with all that fog they introduce in the broken and open sections of the facility. And I felt that the game underutilized the whole background of the chambers and maintenance areas to flesh out the world a bit. The original basically had the same layered concept the Half-Life games have, where you can either experience a very simplistic story on the surface, or you can investigate further and find a lot of hints which build the world, and this seemed absent in Portal 2. Still, there is a bit of world-building, though mostly through the audio logs of Cave Johnson and some of the dialogue form GLaDOS and Wheatley, though I felt that the ending, similarly to the original left me with little closure overall. I actually read this right now and saw that they changed the ending of the original from merely lying outside the facility to actually being dragged away again, which explains why Chell is back inside the Aperture Laboratories. But again, the ending in Portal 2 is a bit lacking. 

Speaking of the characters, they're all very well realized. It's a lot of fun listening to these guys with their quirks. I especially enjoyed Cave Johnson's way of expression and his inflection during the various audio-logs. Though all of the voice-acting was top-notch.

One thing that did irk me greatly were the loading times. Seriously this game loads after every single room and it really breaks the flow at times. And if you die, the reloading of the level also takes ages. I assumed Valve would finally learn something but the loading times were even worse than in Half-Life 2. 

Overall I'm very pleased with this game. I wish it were a bit longer and introduced more new ideas, but then again, drawing it out too much just leads to repetition.

The single most amazing game I've ever played. The great storyline & myths surrounding it help the overall experience of tests through Aperture Science.

Игра - ШЕДЕВР - этим все сказано...

Portal 2 is one of the best games I have ever played!

The Portal 2 singleplayer is well constructed, well thought out and it will bend your mind - especially when you progress and complete the later test chambers! The first character you meet is a core named Wheatley who is voiced by the British comedian Stephen Merchant which makes the whole Portal 2 experience a lot funnier with his little comedic phrases and his comedic timing provide a hilarious world to traverse through. The second character is the main central core with the power to control everything in the testing facilities and her name is GLaDOS, she was the main villain in Portal and she is back with her brilliant sarcasm and her heart piercing insults in Portal 2 and it is brilliant how it ties in with you re-uniting with this core who you last destroyed in Portal.

The Portal 2 multiplayer is fun, challenging and everything is better when you are overcoming a challenging test chamber with your robot buddy! The co-operative missions put a brilliant twist on things making you work as a team and it is as good as the singleplayer if not better because instead of two portals to work with, you now have four which makes the puzzles a lot more challenging but you can balance it out between eachother.

I would recommend this game to anyone, mainly because of how fun it is for all ages and the humour in the game is brilliantly scripted. The characters are really detailed and the world is just fascinating because at one point you could be in some of the chambers that you destroyed in the last game and then you could be in some beautiful, refurbished test chambers so the environment never gets bland or bleak, this game always keeps you on edge and it never gets old!
